department_name: Riverside County Department of Environmental Health

grading_system.description: Uses letter grades A, B, C based on percentage scores with required re-inspection for B or C grades

inspection_details.frequency: 2-3 routine inspections annually for most facilities, with high-risk facilities inspected more frequently
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Grade B or C requires correction of all violations and re-inspection within a week to achieve Grade A
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Grade cards must be posted in location clearly visible to public near main entrance; inspection reports available online through myhealthdepartment.com portal

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Riverside County Fire Department, Office of the Fire Marshal
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial cooking fire extinguishing systems must comply with NFPA 17A, NFPA 96, 2022 CFC, and 2022 CMC; systems require semi-annual inspection and maintenance by licensed technicians
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for kitchen hood fire suppression systems per NFPA standards

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Health and Safety Code (CalCode) and California Retail Food Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Riverside County Department of Environmental Health
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Riverside County Ordinances supplement state CalCode requirements

confidence_notes: Clear verification found for grading system (A/B/C with specific thresholds), inspection authority, frequency, and fire safety requirements from official county sources
verification_notes: All key information verified from official Riverside County Department of Environmental Health and Fire Department sources. Grading thresholds confirmed: A (90-100%), B (80-89%), C (79% and below).
